com.jayway.android.robotium.remotecontrol.install

Class SilentInstaller

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jayway.android.robotium.remotecontrol.install.SilentInstaller

  • public class SilentInstaller
extends java.lang.Object
    RobotiumRC installer designed to extract the contents of ZIP files into parameter-specified locations.

    The app can handle new installs, and overlaying updates to existing installs, or performing a crude "uninstall" by recursively removing files and subfolders from the specified install location.

    The default ZIP file sought for RobotiumRC installs is: RobotiumRCInstall.ZIP

    The default ZIP file sought for RobotiumRC overlays is: RobotiumRCOverlay.ZIP

    The default install location for RobotiumRC is: 

       Windows: C:\RobotiumRC
      
   Linux: /usr/local/robotiumrc
      
     Mac: /Library/robotiumrc

    The app can remove and install, install and overlay, or remove and install and overly in a single invocation if all the parameters are properly specified. If no parameters whatsoever are specified then the app will attempt an install to the default location.

      • parseArgs

        static void parseArgs(java.lang.String[] args)

      • doSAFSInstall

        static int doSAFSInstall()
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Perform RobotiumRC install. The RobotiumRC install is currently always silent (GUI-less).
        If -altdir parameter was specified then the install will attempt to use any provided user-specified directory for the install.

        Any user-specified directories must exist; or, we must not be denied the ability to create them and write/copy files to them.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • modifyPropertiesFile

        static void modifyPropertiesFile(java.io.File root)
                          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method will modify the file local.properties of SamplSpinner, SAFSTestRunner and SAFSTCPMessenger
        It requires that android sdk has been installed.
        It will need androidHome to modify the property file. So please call main() with parameter "-androidhome androidHome", or
        an environment "ANDROID_HOME"/"ANDROID_SDK" should be set to the "Android sdk home directory".
        Parameters:
        root, - File, the root directory where the robotium rc has been installed.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • modifyPropertiesFile

        static void modifyPropertiesFile(java.io.File directory,
                        java.lang.String androidHome,
                        int targetLevel,
                        int defaultSdkLevel,
                        java.lang.String[] automationLibsFolder)
                          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        directory, - File, the Runner or Messenger's project folder.
        androidHome, - String, the android sdk home, to be wrote to local.properties
        targetLevel, - int, the real target level to be set for 'target=Google Inc.:Google APIs:?'
        defaultSdkLevel, - int, for messenger; for Runner.
        automationLibsFolder, - String[], an array of the libs folder of the Runner, the first one will be used, other will be put into properties file as comment Only used when modifying Messenger's property file. null when modifying Runner's property file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        See Also:
        #modifyPropertiesFile(File)}, #addEscapeToFilepath(String)}

      • addEscapeToFilepath

        static java.lang.String addEscapeToFilepath(java.lang.String filepath)
        To build a project, Ant requires that the file path separator "\" must be escaped as "\\" in the .properties file.
        Before writing a file path to the properties file, call this method to get an escaped string.
        Parameters:
        filepath, - String, the file path to be modified
        Returns:
        String, The escaped file path
        See Also:
        #modifyPropertiesFile(File, String, int, int, String)

      • resignOriginalAPK

        static void resignOriginalAPK()
                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method will attempt to re-sign originalAPK with the resignJAR and write it to resignedAPK.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the re-sign JAR file or the originalAPK file are not valid, or if the output directory for the resignedAPK is not valid.

        static void buildMessengerRunner()
                          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method will build RobotiumTestRunner, SAFSTestRunner and SAFSTCPMessenger
        It will use Ant Tool to build. So please call main() with parameter "-anthome antHome", or
        an environment "ANT_HOME" should be set to the "Ant tool home directory".
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        See Also:
        #buildAPK(String, boolean)}

               boolean debug)
        Parameters:

        debug, - boolean, to build a debug or release version
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the build succeed
        See Also:
        buildMessengerRunner()

      • doSAFSOverlay

        static int doSAFSOverlay()
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Perform RobotiumRC Overlay. The RobotiumRC overlay is currently always silent (GUI-less).
        If -overlay parameter was specified then the install will attempt to use the provided Snapshot ZIP file for the overlay.

        The overlay ZIP file must exist. An overlay can be applied immediately following a RobotiumRC Install during the same invocation of this installer. Thus, you can run an initial install and then do an updated overlay on top of that as part of one invocation.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • doSAFSUnInstall

        static int doSAFSUnInstall()

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This SilentInstaller provides no GUI, but will accept some configuration parameters. Any user-specified directories must exist; or, we must not be denied the ability to create them and write/copy files to them.

        Parameters:
        args[] - The following parameters or arguments can be specified:
        • -silent
          Currently, the install for RobotiumRC is always silent (GUI-less).

        • -robotiumrc "robotium install directory"
          Install RobotiumRC files to the user specified directory instead of the default install directory.

          You *must* provide this parameter with the desired install directory--even if default--if the invocation is trying to combine operations like remove then install, or install then overlay, or remove then install then overlay.

        • -overlay RobotiumRCSnapshot.ZIP
          Overlay RobotiumRC files over an existing RobotiumRC installation.
          The overlay can occur immediately following a new installation during the same class invocation.
        • -removerobotiumrc installedrobotiumrc
          Remove the installed RobotiumRC. installedrobotiumrc indicates the directory where RobotiumRC is installed, like "C:\RobotiumRC\" or "/usr/local/robotiumrc"
        • -androidhome androidHome
          It indicates 'the home directory to android sdk' It is used to modify local.properties of Runner and Messenger. Only installsafs is true, this parameter will take effect.
        • -anthome antHome
          It indicates 'the home directory to ant sdk' It is used to build Runner and Messenger. Only both installsafs/overlaysafs and dobuild are true, this parameter will take effect.
        • -dobuild
          If this parameter is present, program will try to build the TestRunner and Messenger. Only installsafs or overlaysafs, this parameter will take effect.
        • -resignjar "<pathTo/re-sign.jar"
          If this parameter is present, along with valid settings for -originalapk and -resignedapk, the installer will attempt to re-sign the -originalapk with the installed SDK credentials and write the new apk out to the -resignedapk path. Only with installsafs will these parameters take effect.
        • -originalapk "<pathTo/SpinnerActivity.apk"
          If this parameter is present, along with valid settings for -resignjar and -resignedapk, the installer will attempt to re-sign the -originalapk with the installed SDK credentials and write the new apk out to the -resignedapk path. Only with installsafs will these parameters take effect.
        • -resignedapk "<pathTo/SpinnerActivity-debug.apk"
          If this parameter is present, along with valid settings for -resignjar and -originalapk, the installer will attempt to re-sign the -originalapk with the installed SDK credentials and write the new apk out to the -resignedapk path. Only with installsafs will these parameters take effect.
        • -v
          Verbose to see the detail installation or un-installation information
        • -testrunner "RobotiumTestRunner or SAFSTestRunner"
          It indicates the test runner to be used. If this is not present, the default test runner is RobotiumTestRunner. This setting will affect the content of local.properties of TCPMessenger project.
